Body:
Description: Hi,
We have received AWS alerts on EPP side regarding the memory usage in AWS of your EPP server.
The Memory usage seems to reach 90% sometimes.
What We've Learned Updated: Optimized EPP server.
Next Steps Updated: Waiting on customer for a remote session to take a look over policies, shadows, etc.

Devops:

In order to investigate further I would recommend that somebody from the Support Team takes a look when they have some time in order to check what could be the cause for this usage (policies not configured correctly, high log load etc. ) and if this is a normal usage pattern and if there is a decision to increase the resources we would need some confirmation around this along with a corresponding ticket as would also be the case for the investigation above.

What We've Learned Updated: We did the following:
- upgraded the EPP server from 5700 to 5941(latest version)
- rebooted the EPP server
- cleared space in the backend
- set Audit Log Backups to also backup and remove logs older than 1 month from the EPP server(currently there were almost 1.5 mil logs - this may have caused performance issues)

What remains to be done: When you have time please upgrade the EPP clients to the latest version. The latest version can be downloaded from System Configuration -> Client Software.
---
Optimized EPP server.

Next Steps Updated: Waiting till next week to make sure that everything is okay and then we will close the ticket. 
---
Waiting on customer for a remote session to take a look over policies, shadows, etc.
